result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse T. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault) [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent including but not limited to Sex Offender Treatment and Cognitive Intervention, and follow through with recommendations. 
Lifetime registration as a Sex Offender.

No Contact with B.R.S. 
Not to use/possess any illegal drugs or alcohol. 
Not use of the internet unless agent approves. 
No utilization of any social media or networking sites. 
No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 years old without agent's approval.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

8:48 AM Case 14CF328 called and held via Zoom. All Court personnel appear via video means. Defendant Jesse T. Adams appeared by video, Attorney Michael R. Cohen appeared by video for Jesse T. Adams, Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to a personal appearance and Court accepts waiver. Parties have a joint agreement for re-sentencing. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense recites joint agreement. 
Court sentences defendant as to count 1: 10 years of initial confinement and 10 years extended supervision. As to count 6: 3 years of initial confinement and 10 years extended supervision. Sentences to run concurrent to one another and any other sentence being served. Defendant has 2,452 days sentence credit. Court finds defendant eligible for any prison programming that he is statutorily eligible for. 
Conditions of extended supervision include: 
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by the Probation Agent. 
No Contact with B.R.S. No use of the internet except with the approval of the Probation Agent. No use of social media or networking platforms. 
No possession or use of illegal drugs, alcohol or non prescribed medications. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment, including appropriate Sex Offender or Cognitive assessments per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Compliance with Lifetime supervision of Serious Sex Offenders.
Per CCAP recommendation to allow DA Office to access/view all documents prior to mandatory e-filing conversion done in 2017.
